Differential Equations | Solving a DE with the Laplace Transform

Solve with the Laplace Transform:\n[imath]\left\{\begin{array}{c}\ny^{\prime \prime}-5 y^{\prime}+6 y=3 e^{2 t} \\\ny(0)=3, y^{\prime}(0)=2 \\\n\sqrt{1}^{2}\n\end{array}\right.[/imath][imath]y^{\prime \prime}-5 y^{\prime}+6 y=3 e^{2 t} [/imath] [imath]y(0)=3, y^{\prime}(0)=2 [/imath] [imath]\sqrt{1}^{2}[/imath]
